intro: Strychnos angolensis var. tanganykae, commonly known as the Tanganyika strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
